description: From Latin abscīsus, perfect passive participle of abscīdō (“cut off”); formed from abs- + caedō (“cut”).

verbs.description: abscise (third-person singular simple present abscises, present participle abscising, simple past and past participle abscised)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cut off. [First attested in the early 17th century.]
(intransitive, botany) To separate by means of abscission; to shed or drop off. [First attested in the early 20th century.]
